column1: full, swinging away from off stump, solidly behind the line as he defends off the front foot
back of a length, swinging away from outside off, lazily rolls his wrists to bunt this to mid-on off the back foot
full, slight shape away from middle stump, looks to flick this late but the swing makes him adjust and push it back to the bowler
good length at leg stump, pushed off the pads to deep square leg
angled across off stump, it's full. He gets to the pitch and uses his wrists to squeeze it past point. Third man cleans up
good length at leg stump, evades his leg glance, hits him on the thigh guard and rolls into the open square leg region
good length, angled down the leg side, lands in front of Saha and he can't gather it to his right. Parries it into the leg side
good length outside off stump, this was 141 kph, but it bit into the pitch. He slashes on the up outside off stump, thick inside edge goes behind him
back of a length at off stump, camps on the back foot and drops this into the off side to steal a run
sweetly timed cover drive, straight to cover point. This was in the slot, overpitched outside off stump and he leaned into it
full and angling away from off stump, checks his drive and offers the full face to push uppishly to mid-off
good length, angled at middle stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot
attempted slower ball, slides down leg side from a length
bursts through his defence. This one is angled to go past off stump, but it straightens after pitching and climbs over the middle stump as Warner is fending at it
back of a length at leg stump, drags it off his hips with a flat-bat, gets it to deep square leg's left
back of a length at leg stump, it's a repeat effort of the previous ball. This time he's leaning into it slightly more and he pulls it harder. Deep square wasn't close this time
back of a length outside off stump, walks into it slightly as he slashes on the up to find point on the bounce
back of a length at middle stump, nips back in and hits him on the inside thigh. He shaped to play the pull again, put this one skids on and cramps him

back of a length at middle stump, gets off the ground to try and whip this through the leg side. He misses and is struck on the pad. Small appeal but the umpire thinks there's an inside edge there. No signal as short third man comes across
back of a length outside off, steps down the track, can't time the slash. Finds mid-off with a toe-ended shot
good length at middle stump, swivels to flick it straight to deep square leg
good length at leg stump, taps it to Amla's left at short midwicket and takes off. Dhawan screams no and sends him back. Amla's throw is weak. Allows him to get back
good length at middle stump, pushes it to short midwicket
rolls his fingers on this, bowls it full at middle stump. Warner backs away and looks to drive through the off side, finds extra cover
slower ball, good length at middle stump, watches it closely and glances it to short fine's right
goes down the track premeditatedly, it's a bouncer from Ishant and he is in a tangle as he plays this. Awkwardly holds up the bat and somehow manages to drop it into the leg side
good length outside off stump, mistimed cover drive, drops into the off side
back of a length at off stump, sits up nicely for him and he punches this on the up, straight to extra cover
slower ball, wide outside off stump at a good length. Opens his arms to punch this, but has to correct himself and push it down the ground to long-off
steps out before the delivery again, cramped again, but this time he gets the bouncer past short fine leg with a mistimed hook. Deep square runs to his left to cut it off
good length outside off stump, driven on the up, top half of the bat, to extra cover

falls to the bouncer eventually. He didn't step out this time, but Dhawan was looking to pummel everything that was short. This one climbs slowly at his right shoulder and he's through the hook shot early. It clips his gloves and balloons above Saha who puts up two hands and holds on to it
good length at middle stump, drops it into the off side off the back foot
good length outside off, 146 kph, nips away and beats him on the attempted cover drive
good length outside off stump, pushes on the up to short extra cover
back of a length slower ball at off stump, defended into the off side off the back foot
drops it short outside off stump, enough time on this pitch for him to spring up and get on top of this. Pulls to deep square leg's left
gives him the charge and makes room, is followed and cramped with a back of a length ball. It hits him on the thigh on the way to short fine leg
tossed up at leg stump, gets down the track and pushes it to long-on after getting to the pitch
good length, offbreak at middle stump, leans in and pushes it into the leg side
back of a length outside off stump, hangs deep and pushes it off the outside half of the bat. Gets it past short third man who slides after running backwards to pull it back in
full at middle stump, he's down early, puts the knee down and reverse sweeps it past short third man
good length at middle stump, tucks it to short fine
full at leg stump, down the track to meet it at the pitch. Driven to long-on
good length at off stump, defends off the back foot
good length at off stump, looks to force this through the off side off the back foot but it's tailing in at him. Cramps him. He can only find extra cover
back of a length outside off stump, he's looking for it to sit up as he attempts to cut this. But this skids through at just above knee height and beats him
slower ball, back of a length outside off stump, looks to power it on the up through the off side, bat turns. It's back down the pitch at the bowler who picks up and throws it to the keeper
full outside off stump, drives it to Maxwell's left at extra cover. He gets a bad bounce as he looks to swivel and unleash a throw. Can't hold on to it
slower ball, good length at leg stump, tucks it off the pads to deep square leg
full at off stump, can't drive this past the bowler on the up, it rolls back to him
short and wide outside off stump, finds sweeper cover with the cut shot
full at middle stump, looks to drive this to long-on but that has hurried him, he pushes it back to the bowler
short and wide outside off stump, hangs back, waits for it, and chips it to sweeper cover
good length at middle stump, opens his stance and chops it late, finds backward point

reverse-ramp for a six. This is flat, good length at middle stump and Cariappa generally is quicker through the air and off the pitch. Perfect for a release shot on this pitch. Warner switches his stance quickly and lifts it with the angle over the third man boundary

this is a good stumping from Saha. Henriques is down the track. It's looped in and spins away from Henriques from an off stump line. He's not to the pitch. It skids very very low and Saha has done well to get down, hold on to it, and then complete the stumping

got him first ball! Good length outside off stump, this goes straight after pitching. Yuvraj pokes at it and he's got a thin outside edge. Saha knows straight away after taking it and his appeal is met with a raised finger
beats him on the outside edge. Good length, drifted in at off stump. Pitches and goes away sharply. Ojha follows with his hands and is beaten
arm ball, angled in outside off stump from a length, stabs at it with no feet and gets the outside edge past slip
good length outside off stump, hangs on the back foot and chops it past point
arm ball, goes down the leg side on a good length
tossed up at leg stump, gets the front leg out of the way and lofts it over Warner at the other end. But there isn't enough power on this. Long-on runs to his left and takes it on the bounce

Mohit loses his footing as he goes for the catch. This is a carrom ball, good length at middle stump. Ojha top-edges a sweep that hangs up to he right and in front of Mohit at deep square. He seems to get there but falls over and that's four in the end as he sticks out a hand to protect himself
back of a length at off stump, backs away and chops it to point
changes his action. This is low-arm and slingy. But he drops it nice and short outside leg stump for Warner to swivel and find the long leg boundary

good length at leg stump, pushed with soft hands towards deep midwicket. Maxwell runs in hard and releases quickly. Ojha is panicking at the non-strikers end as he dives. The throw is wide though and he's safe
full at off stump, driven down to long-off
full at off stump, front leg out of the way as he pummels this drive uppishly towards the bowler. It's hit too hard for the bowler to get down. He ends up stopping it with his boot, unintentionally
back of a length outside off, skids through quickly and beats the outside edge on the cut
back of a length at off stump, shapes to pull this, but it's come through quickly and he just about brings dwon and angled bat to turn this into the leg side
good length at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
tossed up full at middle stump, wants to slog this over the midwicket boundary but he drags it off the inside half of the bat, to deep midwicket's left. it gets him two in the end
good batting. Angled in at the pads from a length, he leans in and pushes with soft hands in front of deep square leg
short ball, angled down leg side. He swivels and gratefully tickles this past short fine leg
back of a length at middle stump, forcefully pushes this off the back foot to get it past extra cover who is diving to his left, single to long-off

another good effort by Mohit. This time he's more balanced and puts out his right hand to stop the four as he realises he's not making it. It was a good length ball that Ojha flicked towards him at deep square
good length at middle stump, looks to slog this to the midwicket boundary, it's mistimed but it's running away till Morganl gets across from long-on to put in a slide
good length at off stump, defends with an angled bat
back of a length at off stump, opens up slightly to make room, watches it closely and dabs it late to get it past short third man
low full toss at middle stump, flicked to deep square leg
back of a length, quicker one outside off stump, too quick as he looks to cut. Beaten.
this is dropped short outside off, gets big on him as he looks to cut, gets it off the handle in the direction of point
good length, angled in at leg stump, tucked to short fine off the front foot
back of a length outside off, waits and waits and waits, then dabs it to short third man

super shot. He wasn't to the pitch after going down the track. This was back of a length at leg stump, and didn't have enough pace. But he goes through with the shot and picks it up over the midwicket boundary
back of a length at leg stump, glanced to deep square leg
short and wide outside off stump, opens the face and runs it down to third man, away from his body
low full toss outside off stump, thick outside edge as he tries to slice this through point for four. Gets it past third man and it's four anyway
yorker outside off stump, jams it into the off side infield, point gets across
back of a length, slides well down the leg side

back of a length at off stump, backs away to create room and cuts it. Point dives to his left and gets a hand to it. third man himself has to tumble after running to his right. In the end, they run really well and come back for the third
slower ball, back of a length at off stump, pitches and balloons over the attempted cut shot. Good ball, but it lands in front of Saha who can't collect it. Deflects off his body into the leg side
back of a length at middle stump, looks to flat-bat this wide of long-on, but that has come in quickly at him. It's a half-shot in the end, lobbed harmlessly, well in front of long-on
back of a length outside off stump, punches it powerfully off the back foot, straight to long-on
full at leg stump, exposes the stumps as he backs away and flicks this to deep midwicket

low-arm action works this time. He slings this from close to the stumps while giving it a flick like he does with his usual carrom ball. This is like ten-pin bowliing. He gets an angle on it, lands it at a length outside off and spins it past Ojha, who swats across the line after stepping out. Misses it completely and his match-changing innings comes to an end
back of a length outside off stump, pushed off the back foot into the off side
back of a length outside off, too wide, he lets it go
full at middle stump, shapes to switch his stance, stays put and drops it into the leg side with soft hands as he leans into this
full outside off stump, 115 kph, squeezes it out to long-off
good length, full at leg stump, once again he pushes with soft hands and teases deep midwicket before beating his throw on the second
slower ball, good length at the pads, walks at it and tucks it fine past the keeper to bring up his fifth consecutive fifty against Kings XI
back of a length slower ball at off stump, opens the face and pushes it to short third man
short ball at middle stump, gets on top of the bounce, keeps the pull shot down and finds deep square leg
back of a length at off stump, makes room and finds sweeper cover with a back foot punch
follows him down the leg side with a short ball, cramps him at chest height and forces him to push it back down the pitch
arm ball from around the wicket, wide of off stump, chopped on the bounce to Ishant at short third man
back of a length at leg stump, works it into the space ahead of deep square and deep midwicket, just about in between them too
good length at middle stump, looks to push it towards long-on, Axar dives to his right  and stops
good length at middle stump, steps out and drops it into the leg side, two more
oh good shot. Gets an overpitched ball at off stump and makes use of it. This is fired in flat, and he drives inside-out to beat long-off comfortably to his left
back of a length at middle stump, pushed off the back foot, wide of deep midwicket. Wants two but this time the fielder is across quickly
impressive shot but only one in the end. This was a short slower ball, wide outside off. He waited a long time to reach out for it and slap it into front of square. Sweeper cuts it off on the bounce
lovely. Low full toss at off  stump, he switches and flicks this past point with half a jab
slower ball, back of a length at off stump, gets an under edge as he tries to punch this through the covers. Can't get it past the infield

holes out to deep square leg. This is a bouncer at middle stump. Hooda gets under it and that's his undoing in the end. Gets a lot of elevation but not enough room to maneuver it. Hits it straight up into the sky and Sandeep is steady under it
back of a length at middle stump, makes room and flat-bats one right off the middle. Straight over the bowler, one bounce into the boundary
nearly loses his stumps. This is a good length offcutter at leg stump. Warner is down on one knee and wants to sweep this past short fine, but he's beaten. It just climbs over the leg stump
he winds up to clobber this bouncer outside off stump, but it's too far away from him and it bounces through to the keeper
short ball at off stump, this time he's on top of the bounce and keeps the pull shot down, finds deep square
and that's all. This is short outside off stump, hardly any pace as it climbs towards him. He tries to drag the hook shot from outside off stump, but can only top edge it to deep midwicket

dropped. Low full toss outside off stump from around the wicket. He lifts this with an angled bat to hit it wide of long-off. He's low on energy and this hasn't gone quickly enough. Morgan has got it covered at long-off but it bursts through his hands as he is slightly off balance. Nearly takes the ballboy on the follow through as he kicks the ground in disgust
back of a length at off stump, walks across the stumps to try and ramp this past short fine, gets it on his thigh guard and it mighty annoyed
finishes with a six. It's a length ball at off stump, nicely in Radhid's arc. He pulls it out and gets sufficient bat to lift it over long-on

gone first ball. Full inswinger, and Amla is trapped on the shuffle, right in front of the stumps, neither going forward nor back. Didn't swing that much, Amla's head fell over and he played all around it
big inswinger again, very full. This time it swings down the leg side and Maxwell tickles it away, nice and fine, to get off the mark
length ball, fifth-stump line, left alone - a bit of inswing, but most of it after it passes the batsman
inswinger coming in towards off stump, good length, stays back and punches into the covers
another inswinger coming in towards off stump, and this one keeps low. Maxwell looks to hit it back over the bowler's head, and only manages to toe-end it, along the ground, towards the keeper
back of a length on off stump, stays leg-side of the ball to push into the point region
back of a length outside off stump, arches back and uses his bottom hand to lift this over the off side infield on the up
full and swinging in at middle stump, stands upright and flicks to deep square leg
short and wide outside off stump, wants to swats this hard through the off side, beaten
full, and swinging in at leg stump. His front leg is away and pointed towards wide mid-on as he lifts this over the bowler off the toe of the bat
back of a length at off stump, chops it to backward point
good length, angled across off stump. He has made too much room in the end and has to really reach out to try and slice this into the off side. Beaten
good length, angled in at off stump. Watchfully pushes it to short midwicket
back of a length at off stump, dabbed to third man
slower ball, full at middle stump. Forced to check his batswing and defend into the off side
full at middle stump, clears the front foot to try and squeeze this past extra cover. He jams the bat into the ground and the ball rolls to extra cover

....and he will take it back into the dugout immediately. This is a length ball outside off stump. He's taken some pace off of it and Maxwell can't time it as a result. He was looking to back away and slap this on the up over Warner at long-off. But it's skied and Warner doesn't have to go too far to his left. Pouches it and lets out a roar
back of a length, angled in at leg stump, flicks the thigh guard and runs down to the keeper's left
good length, angled down the leg side and past the attempted glance
back of a length at middle stump, tucks it off his hips, wide of short fine
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
overpitched at middle stump, walks into the shot as he drives it to mid-on
good length, angled across off stump, chops it down to third man
good length at off stump, gets on his toes and uses his wrists to flick it to deep square
good length, angled away from off stump. Gives him the charge and taps it on the up to mid-on's right. He gets low and cuts it off

six first ball. This is a top quality shot. Back of a length, skids in at off stump. It wasn't too short but  Morgan was back quickly and lifted this, almost with a straight bat, over mid-on and that boundary too
good length, angled in at middle stump, dropped into the leg side off the inside half of the bat
good length at off stump, leans in and defends to extra cover off the front foot
full outside off, sliding straight through. He gets to the pitch and opens the face at the last moment to slice it past point
good length, fired flat at middle stump, whipped off the back foot to backward square leg
back of a length at middle stump, pushed off the back foot to midwicket
fires a slider down the leg side, good length. It clips the pads and runs away fine. Sran gives chase and does really well, despite digging his knee into the turf, to pull it back
full at middle stump, playing for the googly, it's a stock ball. Thick inside edge to short fine
back of a length at middle stump, punched off the back foot to deep midwicket
good shot. Googly is tossed up outside off stump and he picked it. Waited for it to pitch under his eyes and held his balance to lift it cleanly over mid-off
googly, good length, pitches on middle and slides down leg where Ojha has to stick out his left hand to stop it

clattered. What a sound. The perfect connection. This was fired flat, a googly, at middle stump. That was clarity of the mind for him to go down immediately and through with the slog sweep. Cleanly slotted into the stands over the midwicket boundary
and another. This is a googly outside off stump, it's overpitched, and he drives this uppishly, wide of mid-off
back of a length outside off, gives him the charge and chops it to Yuvraj at point...who takes ages to get down. Gives away a run
back of a length outside off stump, looks to dab him to third man and is narrowly beaten on the outside edge
back of a length at middle stump, tucked off his hips to deep square leg
offcutter, full at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length at off stump, finds short midwicket as he looks to shovel this into the leg side off the back foot
full at off stump, pushes it feebly to extra cover
back of a length outside off stump, gets on top of the bounce and taps it on the up to deep midwicket
offcutter, back of a length at leg stump. Steps out and pushes it to short fine after cramping himself
back of a length outside off stump, watches closely and opens the face to run it to third man
oh good bouncer. He wasn't expecting that and he didn't react to well either. This flew through wide of off stump and beat him comprehensively on the hook
slower ball, good length at middle stump. The rotation of the ball means he can't close the face on this powerfully enough to get it into the leg side. It's back at the bowler
full at off stump, leans in and drives it cleanly to long-off's right

Nabi has the last laugh. It's a similar line and length to the first one he bowled today. But this is slightly quicker and it skids through. Keeps low. Morgan is also not as positive as he was at the start of the fifth over. Dot balls do that. He's late on bringing his bat down at this and middle stump takes a knocking
tossed up, full at middle stump, driven firmly inside-out to extra cover
full at middle stump, driven to long-off
good length at off stump, straightens and climbs on him as he looks to work it into the leg side. Leading edge to extra cover

back of a length outside off stump, hangs tall and plays this really late. Opens the face fully to run it towards the third man boundary. Yuvraj gives chase from short fine and acrobatically keeps it in at the line
arm ball, angles in sharply and thuds into his pads as he fends forward at this. It hit him in front of leg stump though and was sliding down
good length at off stump, climbs sharply and hits him high on the bat as he goes on the back foot, rolls into the off side
googly, full at off stump, pushed softly to extra cover
full at middle stump, he shapes to sweep and has to quickly adjust. Yorks himself in the end and taps it back to the bowler

breaks through him! A woeful shot. Miller didn't have a clue. This was a slider, aimed at leg stump from back of a length. Miller is looking to go back quickly, make room and cut it square. In the end, he's in a weird tangle between all three and hears the stumps break
tossed up at off stump, leans in to get to the pitch, drives straight to extra cover

and another! Off stump is gone this time! Really gives a rip to this googly. It's good length, outside off stump. Saha is pushing with his stumps exposed and plays inside the line. It goes past his outside edge and hits the off stump

oh so close! He's trapped right in front of off stump, playing on the back foot to this full ball. The umpire says no! It looked dead but he says it's inside edge. Anil Dandekar is the umpire. Replays show there was no edge there.
good length at off stump, chips it past a diving Nabi, single to long-on
back of a length at off stump, jammed into the off side of the back foot
back of a length at off stump, pushed off the back foot into the off side
full at off stump, defended back to the bowler
dropped! Tossed up at middle stump, Axar pushes at this lazily, well in front of his body. Lobs it back, straight to Nabi who puts down an absolute sitter
back of a length at middle stump, goes deep in the crease and tucks it to deep square leg
googly, good length at off stump, leans in and pushes to extra cover's left
back of a length at off stump, hangs back and chops it to sweeper cover
back of a length at off stump, mistimed cut to short third man's left
googly, angled into the leg stump, misses on the sweep, cops it on the back leg. Appeal turned down, this was going down
back of a length outside off stump, goes for the pull but this turns away and slides below his bat
back of a length, angled in at middle stump, hangs back and tucks it to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off stump, gives him the charge. Not to the pitch. Drags this on the up and finds midwicket
back of a length at off stump, cut to sweeper point who runs in and fumbles
good length at off stump, angles in, punched off the back foot to sweeper
back of a length, flat at middle stump. It hurries him but he gets enough on the whip to get it uppishly past midwicket and then wide of long-on
short at middle stump, he's hurried on the pull again. Once more he adjusts just enough to chip it over midwicket
back of a length outside off stump, late on this as he drives through the line, under-edge into the pitch and back to the bowler
slower ball, back of a length outside off stump, slapped on the up to long-off
good length at off stump, winds up, deep in his crease, and hammers it on the up to long-off
good length, very wide outside off stump. No way he's getting to that without moving his feet. That's the course he chooses. Slashes well away from his body and slices it generously to sweeper cover
full ball at middle stump, walks across and gets rapped on the pad, but there was a big inside edge first

Nabi almost pulls off a stunner. This is short and in the corridor. It's sliding through and he looks to ramp this over short third man. It flies to Nabi's left. There's some pace on it though so he reaches out with his right hand, similar to when Colingwood caught Hayden all those years ago. But he can't hold on. Dropped. Parries it and gives chase in the end

glorious shot. Back of a length outside off stump, a flourish with the bat swing and brings it down with force under the ball to lift it over deep cover. He has no business coming in at No. 8 and playing that shot on this pitch. Incredible.
goes for the slower ball, it slips out of his hand and is well past the wide marker on the full
good length offcutter at off stump, turned to short third man who hits the strikers stumps direct, but not before Vohra had made the crease
slower ball, full at off stump. Waits under it and lifts it cleanly over the umpire to bring up a very impressive fifty

misfielded. Full slower ball at middle stump. He flicks it wide of deep midwicket, where Hooda runs to his left, covers it and then messes up as he looks to pick it up. Fumbles and tumbles at the same time
back of a length outside off, looks to ramp it through third man again, beaten

superb from Dhawan. But superb from Vohra first. This is a full ball outside off stump. He slices this expertly over point and it's bouncing away towards the square boundary there. But Dhawan is nimble and quickly across to his left at sweeper and then times a jump to pick it up cleanly as it bounces in front
googly, good length at off stump, drags it to deep midwicket with the spin after stepping out
googly, dropped short at middle stump, picks the length quickly and places the pull between deep square and deep midwicket
beaten. Expects the googly and offers the sweep at this length ball at off stump. It turns away, beaten
dropped short at middle again, googly again, and this time he nails the pull shot off the middle. Clears deep square leg
another googly goes for six! This is tossed up at off stump, he's put a stride down the track and lifted this gorgeously over the bowler. Stunning batting from Vohra!

another misfield and it's 21 off the over! Rashid drops it short at middle stump once again, and it's spinning into Vohra once again. This time he swivels so he can hit it behind square. He drags it there and the fielder fumbles at the boundary after running to his right
low full toss at leg stump, thick inside edge to deep midwicket as he looks to drive this

another twist. Slower ball at a length outside off stump, Mohit attempts that slice again. This time the pitch is true to its character. He can't hit it off that length and that pace over the off side. Finds Dhawan at sweeper. Was that a smart option?
Vohra keeps going. Low full toss outside off stump, completely focused as he waits for this and slices it past point with an open face. Dhawan can't get across this time

dropped! Should we switch to bold text for the rest of the night? This is back of a length outside off stump. Vohra has played a classy back foot punch, right off the middle but it is flat and straight at Dhawan who has lost it in his mid-riff after taking the catch. Put it down as he lost balance. Warner's celebration was short-lived.
back of a length outside off stump, fends at it away from the body and is beaten. There's a loud appeal and the umpire turns it down
back of a length outside off stump, beaten again as he wafts across the line
clears the front foot, clears long-on! Length ball at off stump, clears the front leg, taps it on the up with a flat bat and lifts it over long-on whose leap wasn't enough

low full toss, tails in sharply at middle stump and causes him discomfort. He has shuffled too much and just about gets the inside half of the bat on this. It runs past short fine but there's a deep backward square
full and angled in at middle stump, jams it in front of deep midwicket with soft hands and returns for the second the way Warner had done throughout his innings
this is a yorker at middle stump. Bat turns in his hands as he meets it on the full to turn it to deep square leg off the bottom of the bat
length ball at middle stump, climbs above the stumps and his attempted slog across the line

finally gets one in the slot, but they can't get the second. This is good length at off stump, he backs away and gets bat on this thump on the up. It's to extra cover's right who puts in a hand just in time to parry it to long-off who does really well to keep it down to one
this was coming! The only explanation is that Vohra has asked him to play his shots. Bhuvi delivers the perfect yorker at leg stump. Cariappa steps out, plays all around it and loses his stumps.
Ishant brings sense to the middle, along with a grin. Maintains his balance, gets behind the line of this length ball at off stump, and taps it through the covers to turn over the strike

it's a five-for for Bhuvi! And surely that's the match for Sunrisers. It has been truly special from Vohra, one of the the great IPL innings without a doubt. But that has masked what Bhuvi has done at the other end. Low full toss at middle stump, right in front of middle stump as he misses the flick
oversteps. Yorker tailing in at off stump, brings the bat down and squeezes it to long-on
he's through the slog before this slower ball reaches him. He's in the follow through as it climbs over the off stump
slower ball at off stump, gets behind the line and taps it into the off side
good length at off stump, defends off the front foot to extra cover and keeps them alive for one more over

oh what a shot! These Punjab team-mates will have a lot to talk about after this! He's across the off stump and waiting on one knee. Kaul bowls a length ball and Sandeep has managed to lift it over Sran at short fine. He gives chase and nearly fumbles in his eagerness to hold on
slower ball, outside off stump. Was that wide? Looked like it has just come back in from the marker, but it's given. He was looking to hit this over the midwicket boundary
back of  a length outside off stump, stands tall and punches this classily to sweeper cover
no, no, no, no. Not there. He looks nervous. Bowls it full and wide down the leg side
oh god. Low full toss at off stump, he's tapped it straight back to the bowler with a high elbow

Kaul has shattered the off stump! After all the length balls and the wides, Kaul has found the yorker. Ishant looks to slice this past point but that is too good for him. Kaul has his arms outstretched as he runs wild through the off side. He's tackled by Yuvraj Singh. It's been an all-Punjab star cast for this final phase of the game...just not the IPL franchise.
